entries.title: Mitsubishi Electric to repair F-15 fighter jet radars

summary.#text:
Mitsubishi Electric Corporation has announced a pilot contract with Raytheon, an RTX business, to repair transmitters used in the APG-63 (V)1 radars of F-15 fighter jets operated by the U.S. Air Force (USAF) and its allied forces. Under this pilot contract, Raytheon will assess Mitsubishi Electric’s repair capabilities with the intention of establishing a long-term […]

The post Mitsubishi Electric to repair F-15 fighter jet radars first appeared on Defence Blog.

entries.title: Leonardo DRS reaches 1,000 sensor deliveries for missile warning

summary.#text:
Leonardo DRS, Inc. has announced the delivery of its 1,000th advanced sensor package, a core component of BAE Systems’ 2-Color Advanced Warning System (2CAWS). As noted by the company, this next-generation missile warning and hostile fire detection system is designed to protect U.S. Army pilots and crews from emerging missile threats. The advanced DRS 2-color […]

The post Leonardo DRS reaches 1,000 sensor deliveries for missile warning first appeared on Defence Blog.

entries.title: Belarus unveils Iranian-designed drones in military parade

summary.#text:
Iranian-designed Shahed-136 drones, known as Geran-2 in Russia, were showcased in Belarusian service for the first time during a military parade in Minsk, the capital of Belarus. The drones, which appear to have been designated as Kochevnik (Nomad) by Belarus, were prominently displayed on Chinese GWM King Kong Cannon pickup trucks serving as launch platforms. […]

The post Belarus unveils Iranian-designed drones in military parade first appeared on Defence Blog.

entries.title: Ukrainian Air Force showcases HAWK missile system

summary.#text:
The Ukrainian Air Force has unveiled the U.S.-supplied HAWK surface-to-air missile system, which has been effectively used to counter Russian suicide drones and cruise missiles. This system has reportedly downed over two dozen Iranian-designed Shahed drones and four missiles targeting Ukrainian civilian infrastructure. The HAWK, an acronym for Homing All the Way Killer, has undergone […]

The post Ukrainian Air Force showcases HAWK missile system first appeared on Defence Blog.

entries.title: Czechia launches suicide drone production for Ukraine

summary.#text:
The Czech-Ukrainian company UAC has commenced the manufacturing of unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) in Czechia, specifically for the Ukrainian army. The company, which employs approximately 80 people, primarily Ukrainians, produces various types of drones, including the Leleka-LR (Stork-LR) reconnaissance drone and the Mace loitering munition. “In November, we started trial operation, and in April, we […]

The post Czechia launches suicide drone production for Ukraine first appeared on Defence Blog.

entries.title: Peru moves forward with South Korean FA-50 jet purchase

summary.#text:
The government of Peru is making progress in negotiations with South Korea and the Korean Aerospace Industries (KAI) for the purchase of between 20 and 24 KAI FA-50 light combat aircraft. Sources from both Peru and South Korea indicate that a letter of intent is expected to be signed in the coming weeks, with a […]

The post Peru moves forward with South Korean FA-50 jet purchase first appeared on Defence Blog.

entries.title: Poland step closer to start of K2 tank production

summary.#text:
On Tuesday, July 2, representatives from Polska Grupa Zbrojeniowa S.A. (PGZ) met with officials from Hyundai Rotem Company to finalize a strategic cooperation agreement for the production of K2 tanks in Poland. According to a press release from PGZ, this meeting is part of ongoing industrial dialogue aimed at enhancing Poland’s defense capabilities through international […]

The post Poland step closer to start of K2 tank production first appeared on Defence Blog.

entries.title: Russia deploys rare TOR-M2KM system on Sevastopol beach

summary.#text:
In Sevastopol, located in the temporarily occupied Crimea, Russian forces have stationed a TOR air defense system above a public beach. This was reported by the partisan group “ATESH” on July 1, accompanied by photographs documenting the placement. “Once again, the occupying forces have chosen an ‘ideal’ location for their anti-aircraft missile system, placing it […]

The post Russia deploys rare TOR-M2KM system on Sevastopol beach first appeared on Defence Blog.

entries.title: Russia develops combat buggy to hunt Ukrainian drones

summary.#text:
Russian forces have introduced a new combat buggy named “ZVeraBoy.” The vehicle, which uses the letter “Z” as a symbol of aggression against Ukraine, is equipped with a remote-controlled machine gun turret featuring twin PKT machine guns, an additional mount with six AK-12 rifles, and improvised canister mortars for close-range engagements. Despite the propaganda surrounding […]

The post Russia develops combat buggy to hunt Ukrainian drones first appeared on Defence Blog.

entries.title: Boeing delivers first CH-47F Block II to US Army

summary.#text:
In support of the U.S. Army’s ongoing modernization efforts, Boeing has delivered the first CH-47F Block II Chinook. As noted by the company, this delivery is part of a broader plan to modernize up to 465 Chinooks in the Army’s fleet to the new Block II configuration. “The CH-47F Block II provides capability improvements allowing […]

The post Boeing delivers first CH-47F Block II to US Army first appeared on Defence Blog.
